abstract: A strong yen and slow sales in Japan pushed down quarterly profit 39 percent, but the world’s biggest automaker raised its full-year net profit forecast.
snippet: A strong yen and slow sales in Japan pushed down quarterly profit 39 percent, but the world’s biggest automaker raised its full-year net profit forecast.
lead_paragraph: TOKYO  Toyota Motor said Tuesday that its profit had slumped 39 percent in its third quarter from the period a year earlier, weighed down by slow sales at home and the strong yen.

headline.main: A Stronger Yen and Fewer Sales Reduce Toyota Earnings 39%
headline.print_headline: A Stronger Yen and Fewer Sales Reduce Toyota Earnings 39%

abstract: Federal investigators found that mechanical defects that had already been addressed were the only known cause of the acceleration problem.
snippet: Federal investigators found that mechanical defects that had already been addressed were the only known cause of the acceleration problem.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — After dissecting Toyota’s engine control software and bathing its microchips in every type of radiation engineers could think of, federal investigators found no evidence that the company’s cars are susceptible to sudden acceleration from electronic failures, the government said Tuesday.

headline.main: Electronic Flaws Did Not Cause Toyota Problems, U.S. Says
headline.print_headline: U.S. Inquiry Finds No Electronic Flaws in Toyotas
